task_summary: Pick up the red cylindrical object from the table using the robotic arm.

task_long_description.overview: A robot arm must locate, approach, and pick up a red cylinder resting on a black table. The surrounding workspace contains blue markers, possibly for localization. The red object is clearly visible, stationary, and positioned free of occlusions. The arm executes perception, approach, grasp synthesis, and manipulationâ€”using a top strategy to lift the object. Accuracy and object stability are prioritized.
preconditions: The red cylinder is present and at rest on the table within the arm's workspace.
The gripper is empty and operational.
Sufficient workspace clearance exists to actuate the arm.
stepwise_plan: Verify the red object is visible or scan to locate it.
Trigger object detection for precise localization.
Open the gripper to the appropriate width.
Move the end-effector above the red object.
Approach and align to the grasp pose with tight tolerance.
Command the gripper to grasp at the computed pose.
Verify the object is securely held.
success_criteria: The red object is firmly held by the gripper after the process.
No objects are dropped during the sequence.
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect object: Retry scan and detection up to three attempts.
Failed grasp: Task abort (tree ends after verification fails); no place/retry specified in episode.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when the robot confirms the red object is held in the gripper or upon repeated failures to acquire it.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if the red cylinder is currently visible in the workspace
Performs a grid-pattern scan to locate the red cylinder if not visible
Triggers red object detection for pose estimation
Opens the gripper to width suitable for grasping the red cylinder
Moves the gripper directly above the target at 5cm offset
Computes the top-down approach pose for the red cylinder and stores in blackboard
Carefully approaches and aligns to the computed top grasp within 5mm tolerance
Executes grasp at computed pose using top strategy
Verifies the red cylinder is currently held by the gripper

failure_modes: Red object not visible due to occlusion or lighting
Detection pose failure (returns null, object pose noisy)
Failed grasp (slip or force too low)
recovery_strategy: Retry scan pattern up to 3 times if object not visible
Abort task if detection and retrieval fails after troubleshooting
assumptions: The red object in the instruction corresponds to the red cylinder visible in all frames.
No place action is required (only pick); episode ends after secure hold is achieved.
Exact object mass/force not specified; default null for grasp force.

expected_success_criteria: Robot holds the red cylinder at the end of sequence.
No collisions or misplaced grip occur.
Task fails gracefully if object is missing or grasp fails.
